Osorio, Guido
metadata.dc:description: A 45 years old male in whom a Hodgkin disease, nodular sclerosis variety, IIIBS, with splenectomy was diagnosed at the age of 27 years of age, is reported. He was treated initially with chemotherapy C-MOPP and radiotherapy, obtaining a complete remission of the disease two years later. In December 2000, after 17 years of remission, the disease relapsed with generalized lymph node enlargement and lung involvement. He was treated with ABVD chemotherapy, but died after 5 cycles due to a febrile neutropenia, bronchopneumonia and respiratory distress.
metadata.dc:title: Recaída de enfermedad de Hodgkin en adulto tras 17 años de remisión completa continua. Caso clínico.
[Relapse of Hodgkin disease after 17 years of complete remission. A case report].
